translations.chinese: 漢王跳，獨與滕公共車出成皋玉門，北 渡河，宿小脩武。
translations.english: King Han leapt away, alone with Lord Teng sharing a chariot out of Chenggao's Jade Gate. They crossed north over the Yellow River and stayed at Xiao Xiuwu.

translations.chinese: 自稱使者，晨馳入張耳、韓信壁，而奪之軍。
translations.english: He called himself an envoy and at dawn galloped into Zhang Er and Han Xin's encampment, seizing command of their army.
He then had Zhang Er go north to gather troops in Zhao territory.
In the seventh month of autumn, a comet appeared at Dajiao.
King Han got Han Xin's army and was greatly strengthened again.
